name: Sheraton Hanoi Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights at the Sheraton Hanoi. Check-in was good. Our room was ready despite it being only 10am.
reviews.title: Nice Location Away From The Crowds
Away from the hustle bustle
reviews.text: Our room was on the 8th floor with the view of the lake. It was a cosy room with no obvious faults and very clean. Fair enough, the design wasn't ultra modern nor chic. But it has its charm. Nice comfortable large bed and pillows. Bath was big enough for our daily hot bath to reduce the aches and pains from all day walking.
We only had breakfast. At USD26 per head it was not bad. Really nice croissant.
reviews.title: Disappointing. Service needs major improvement.
Excellent but a bit old
reviews.text: We spent the last part of every evening at the Lobby since that was the only area with free wifi. There were around 7 PCs at Link@Sheraton and you can print up to 5 pages free of charge.

Locationwise, it was nice. Less than 10 minutes from the Old Quarter, you could either take the hotel shuttle, the ever ready taxi, or jump on the bus! Having read that Hanoi is notorious for taxi scams we tried minimizing cab rides to the bare essentials. We only took it twice back to the hotel later in the evenings. And again, only take the CP Cab or Hanoi Cab. Both our cab rides were fine. Otherwise we took the bus. The bus stop was less than 5 minutes away at 33 Au Co - turning right after the hotel driveway. I think we took buses almost 10 times. It was never crowded and we never had to wait longer than 5 minutes. The flat rate was 5000 Dong. We had the Google Map print-outs and the conductors were always helpful in letting us know when to get down.
reviews.title: Nice breakfast

reviews.text: This property is okay but it seems to lack warmth. Rooms are decorated with a rather homely floral wallpaper augmented by a dated emerald green carpet that, as others have already noted, smelled musty. The washroom’s shower door was broken in my suite and water spilled out on the floor. As well, evening lighting in the suite was gloomy and not overly welcoming. The food in the main Vietnamese restaurant was very good and its breakfast was solid, although not anything out of the ordinary. Overall, not a particularly memorable stay.
reviews.title: A rather bland and forgettable hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here on business with a group. The hotel is what you would expect from this chain. Large room plenty of facilities both in and out of the room. The hotel employs friendly staff who all speak English and will always try and assist. The food was of a very high astandard with choices ranging friom western to traditional vietnamise. It is not in the city centre but with taxi fares in Hanoi it was extremely cheap to travel to both places of work and places to visit.Well worth a stay
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay on business

reviews.text: This was my first time to stay in Hanoi and I chose the Sheraton on the group's reputation. I looked an oldish property outside of the city which is easily accessible by taxi and the fares are cheap, but depending on traffic it can take some time. I had come up from Saigon where I had also stayed at a Sheraton property. I found this property much better with staff that were happy to serve you and not to continually try and sell extras.
reviews.title: Good place to stay in Hanoi but may be too far out for some

reviews.text: The rooms are quite old but old but are comfortable and have all that is needed. the Sheraton sweet sleeper bed was good. I had a great view of the lake. The area surrounding the lake is a good place to wander around with places to eat. the breakfast buffet was good with plenty of choice. The Vietnamese coffee is especially good.
reviews.title: Needs updating

reviews.text: The Internet is chargeable in the rooms but they have the Link area on the ground floor by he bar which is wireless and free but does get noisy at times.
reviews.title: Good place in good location.

reviews.text: I went to Hanoi to accompany a cousin sister attending a forum in the hotel. We shared a room, facing the lake...great scenery. I had great time having coffee in the looking out the window every morning, and having my tea viewing the dusk scenery by the lake.
reviews.title: A cool stay by the lake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When arrived at the hotel, I was quite skeptical of the hotel location, which is abt 10-15mins drive from the town. But actually not to worry at all....the hotel provides free shuttle to the town few times a day starting from 9am to 6pm, which is excellent!! The driver, "Tuan" is very friendly and helpful. Despite his limited English, he kept on advising us to bargain during our shopping trip, to ensure that we were not taken for a ride by the shops, advised us abt the motorbike taxis, etc. On 2nd day, we wanted to go to Dong Xian Market, which was out of the shuttle route. But seeing 2 ladies who was not so sure of our way, he agreed to send us there, as the shuttle was empty and no other passengers. We were so thankful of him.
reviews.title: Check location before booking.
Convenient Hotel
reviews.text: I think the concierge of this hotel is the BEST so far!!! All the boys are very helpful, cheerful and friendly. They are always ready and eager to help, eventhough we didnt give any tips to them. Kudos to the Management for selecting good fit of the front service staff!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Outside the hotel, you can find japanese restaurant, mini markets (with English speaking shopkeeper), and Saint Honore, a great cafe & patisserie.
reviews.title: Not up to standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bed is comfortable....slept like a baby when i was there...probably too tired from the walking and shopping around town.
reviews.title: Great experience, wish we stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this Hotel for a week in November and I can honestly say we enjoyed our stay. The foyer was unusual having the dining area in view. The rooms were clean and we had slippers and dressing gowns provided, also an iron and ironing board included very handy if you have more than one trip to make. The staff were always there to help and on a few occasions helped us with the language and money with the Taxi's, which were neccessary as the Hotel is quite a way into Hanoi itself. There was always a cheerful greeting and smile as you entered and exited.
reviews.title: Shereton Hanoi Hotel

reviews.text: A little tired and dated but clean. Out of the city and the bar was under renovation. The buffet dining option is not great but the steakhouse is very good. Some limited dining options nearby. Ok for a short stay.
reviews.title: A little tired and out of the way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Sheraton for 3 nights, I had read some previous reviews and was a little sceptical.
reviews.title: A genuine 5* hotel

reviews.text: I have to say that all my fears were unfounded, it is a genuine 5* hotel and deserves the rating.
reviews.title: Solid 4-5 Star Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were large and very modern, even a seperate bath & shower, and had all the ammenities including Robes & Slippers.
reviews.title: Great stay

description: Truly a “resort within the city,” Sheraton Hanoi Hotel provides the perfect balance between tranquility and convenience. Take in panoramic views of Hanoi’s largest lake and enjoy great comforts in the 299 spacious guest rooms and suites, specially designed to help you relax. Gather in the Link at Sheraton, a communal, interactive space that keeps you connected to what matters most. Experience stunning Sheraton Club Rooms, all with Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Beds, while enjoying the added benefits of Sheraton Club Lounge.
